Submodules¶

textattack.tokenized_text module¶

class textattack.tokenized_text.TokenizedText(model, text)¶

Bases: object

first_word_diff(other_tokenized_text)¶

Returns the index of the first word in self.words() that differs from other_words. Useful for word swap strategies.

replace_new_words(new_words)¶

This code returns a new TokenizedText object and replaces old list of words with a new list of words, but preserves the punctuation and spacing of the original message.

replace_word_at_index(index, new_word)¶

This code returns a new TokenizedText object where the word at index is replaced with a new word.

replace_words_at_indices(indices, words)¶

This code returns a new TokenizedText object where the word at index is replaced with a new word.

words()¶

Returns the distinct words from self.text.

@TODO Should we consider case when substituting words?

textattack.tokenized_text.raw_words(s)¶

Lowercases a string, removes all non-alphanumeric characters, and splits into words.

textattack.utils module¶

class textattack.utils.ANSI_ESCAPE_CODES¶

Bases: object

Escape codes for printing color to the terminal.

BOLD = '\x1b[1m'¶
FAIL = '\x1b[91m'¶
GRAY = '\x1b[37m'¶
HEADER = '\x1b[95m'¶
OKBLUE = '\x1b[94m'¶
OKGREEN = '\x1b[92m'¶
STOP = '\x1b[0m'¶
UNDERLINE = '\x1b[4m'¶

This color stops the current color sequence.

WARNING = '\x1b[93m'¶
textattack.utils.cache_path(file_path)¶
textattack.utils.color_from_label(label_num)¶

Colors for labels (arbitrary).

textattack.utils.color_text_terminal(text, color=None)¶
textattack.utils.download_if_needed(folder_path)¶
textattack.utils.get_device()¶
textattack.utils.http_get(url, out_file, proxies=None)¶
